I have consistently rejected Seeker_D in previous rounds, hoping for a higher-ranked candidate (Seeker_A, C, B, or E) to apply. Seeker_D's current message correctly assesses the market reality: my preferred candidates have likely matched elsewhere, as I am still open. Given the advanced stage of the simulation (Round 7), the probability of securing Seeker_A, Seeker_C, or Seeker_E (all of whom rank Company_E last) is extremely low. While Seeker_B ranks E 4th, holding out further risks remaining unmatched, which is the worst outcome. Securing a match, even with the lowest priority candidate, is now the prudent strategic move to fill the quota.
